div.p: ADULT who is a MEMBER of an ARMY.
1. There is no current general word for a soldier of any rank, and the collective term for soldiers is jūn 軍 "army". See ARMY
2. Zú 卒 and the archaic tú 徒 refer to an ordinary infantry soldier, and these footsoldiers never ride chariots.
3. Jiǎ 甲 refers to armoured soldiers riding in carriages.
4. Jì 騎 refers to cavalry (Han dynasty).
6. Yì 役 refers to a conscript soldier.
7. Xiǎo rén 小人 (jūn zǐ 君子 "soldier of a higher grade") refers generically to the lower grades in the army.
8. Shì 士 refers to officers riding chariots in battle.
NB: Bīng 兵 "soldier" may turn out to be post-Han. I have not yet found a clear example where the word refers to a soldier.
士，泛指一般的士兵，有表敬意味。
丁，泛指士兵，與 “ 兵 ” 等連用。
舟師 refers generally to the navy.
親兵 (lit) refers to a traditional bodygard.
rough draft to BEGIN TO identify synonym group members for analysis, based on CL etc. 18.11.2003. CH ／

bibl.title: A Dictionary of Selected Synonyms in the Principal Indo-European Languages
Anthologia sive Florilegium rerum et materiarum selectarum

note.p: 1. There is at least one sound example of bi1ng 兵 referring to soldiers: ZUO 徒兵千 "one thousand footsoldiers", contrary what WL claims.

bibl.title: 古漢語常用詞同義詞詞典

entry.def: Zú 卒 and the archaic tú 徒 refer to an ordinary infantry soldier, and these footsoldiers never ride chariots.

sense.def: soldiers in the army of hell, short for 獄卒
troops; foot-soldier, ordinary infantry soldier 一卒

bibl.title: 簡明古漢語同義詞詞典

entry.def: Shì 士 refers to officers riding chariots in battle.

sense.def: officer on a war chariot who is protected by shield and helmet

entry.def: Yì 役 refers to a conscript soldier.

sense.def: serve as conscript labour force; serve as conscript soldiers

entry.def: Zú 卒 and the archaic tú 徒 refer to an ordinary infantry soldier, and these footsoldiers never ride chariots.

sense.def: border guards; a border garrson; garrison soldiers

entry.def: Jiǎ 甲 refers to armoured soldiers riding in carriages.

sense.def: ZUO Xuan 2: armoured soldier; heavily armed soldier
fangyan, extremely rare: southern dialect word for a soldier with unknown connotations

entry.def: There is no current general word for a soldier of any rank, and the collective term for soldiers is jūn 軍 "army". See ARMY

sense.def: soldiers; detachment of soldiers forming a "wing" or formal part of an army 右軍3
fast rider on a post horse

entry.def: Jì 騎 refers to cavalry (Han dynasty).

bibl.title: 簡明古漢語同義詞詞典

entry.def: Xiǎo rén 小人 (jūn zǐ 君子"soldier of a higher grade") refers generically to the lower grades in the army.

sense.def: attendant officers on the left and right
